message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.IT. 

This paper deals with the problem of designing optimal auctions, which is a central topic in the field of game theory and mechanism design. The paper specifically focuses on auctions for selling two items with negatively correlated valuations among items, which is a common setting in auction theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.GT (Computer Science > Computer Science and Game Theory), which is dedicated to research on game theory and its applications in computer science. 

The paper also involves optimization and algorithmic techniques for finding the optimal auction, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DS (Computer Science > Data Structures and Algorithms). 

Moreover, the paper uses techniques from artificial intelligence (AI) and information theory (IT) to address the difficulties in designing optimal auctions, which makes cs.AI (Computer Science > Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IT (Computer Science > Information Theory) likely sub-categories as well. 

Finally, the paper is focused on revenue optimization, which is a key aspect of mechanism design and auction theory, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.EC (Computer Science > Economics and Computation), which is dedicated to research on the intersection of computer science and economics.
